intro: Hieracium belsetanum, commonly known as the Belsetan hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are typically arranged in a single head. Hieracium belsetanum is a herbaceous plant that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
